messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Tax Break
messages.msgSnippet: Unless you are making money by homeschooling (charging tuition?), there is nothing to write it off of. You can t write it off of nonrelated income. -pam
messages.messageBody:
Unless you are making money by homeschooling (charging tuition?), there is nothing to write it off of. You can't write it off of nonrelated income.

-pam

On Friday, August 29, 2003, at 01:35PM, Shannon <davenshan@...> wrote:

messages.subject: Re: Computer games
messages.msgSnippet: So, what role playing games do your members of your family enjoy? Give me some titles that I can go get. Deana, three favorites of the house...Zoo Tycoon &
messages.messageBody:
"So, what role playing games do your members of your family enjoy?
Give me some titles that I can go get."


Deana, three favorites of the house...Zoo Tycoon & Lemonade Stand for
PC, Harvest Moon games on PS one, two, and Gameboy. I just bought a
Wheel of Fortune game, a Scrabble game and Casino game for PC also. I
can go with any kind of game series except fighting and ds that's 12
has no problem with it. He thinks they are boring. He has bouts with
the Need for Speed series which I don't like but don't complain
about. We've discussed what I don't like about them and at this time
he doesn't play the parts that are offensive to me. I'm sleep
deprived....good night! Sara


--- .> .
>

>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Re: Computer games
messages.msgSnippet: ... Over here it is:  Zoo Tycoon, Warcraft III,  Age of Mythology, Emperor Rise of the Middle Kingdom,  Star Siege, Pharaoh, Zeus....those are a few. Pam G
messages.messageBody:
> So, what role playing games do your members of your family enjoy? Give me
> some titles that I can go get.
>
>
>

Over here it is: Zoo Tycoon, Warcraft III, Age of Mythology, Emperor Rise
of the Middle Kingdom, Star Siege, Pharaoh, Zeus....those are a few.
Pam G


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Re: Computer games
messages.msgSnippet: I don t know how old he is, but my son enjoys The Pharos, Zeus, and others that can you can see here http://www.sierra.com/home.do has some free downloadable
messages.messageBody:
I don't know how old he is, but my son enjoys The Pharos, Zeus, and others that can you can see here http://www.sierra.com/home.do has some free downloadable trial versions you can check out. Also 'Age of Empires' web site has some free trial versions too.

If he likes the strategy of the games as my husband does *Masters of Orion, *Starcraft, Lords of Magic, *Shogun, Warcraft, Galactic Civilizations, Lords of the realm, Age of Empires II, Axis and Allies, Risk, Dune 2000, NHL2002(he like hokey?) are some of the games on our shelves some of them are for older kids so check themout before you by.

We also have Harry potter; the Tycoon's Railroad, Zoo, Rollercoaster; as well as some Sims tower, city;

Check out the link I gave you and look do some searches Sierra is a pretty good games company.

Teresa in Canada
----- Original Message -----
From: DW
To: Unschooling-Discussion@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, August 25, 2003 5:33 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-Discussion] Re: Computer games


Hi!
Thanks for the advice! I hadn't thought of it that way before. I was trying to think of a way to be more supportive of his "computer learning" so I think I might order him some new role playing games. He will just fall on the floor from shock if "MOM" actually bought him some games. <big grin> But if it were anything else that he or my daughter were into I wouldn't hesitate to go get it. I do believe in providing resources within reason.

So, what role playing games do your members of your family enjoy? Give me some titles that I can go get.

Deana

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] Re: Computer games
messages.msgSnippet: So, what role playing games do your members of your family enjoy? Give me some titles that I can go get. Ages of the Empires is a huge hit over here.   Final
messages.messageBody:
So, what role playing games do your members of your family enjoy? Give me some titles that I can go get.


Ages of the Empires is a huge hit over here. Final Fantasy 7 is also good, there is a lot of reading. I can't believe that I am in support of these games now. lol

I didn't read all the posts on this topic- I have too many e-mails about John Taylor Gatto that I am trying to sift thru while trying to hear the program he was on today. I am having difficulty with finding the story on the audio player. : (

Connie


"Education- compulsory schooling, compulsory learning- is a tyranny and a crime against the human mind and spirit. Let all those escape it who can, any way they can." John Holt

"Do WE work for CONGRESS, or is it the other way around? If Congress works for us, and We the People give Congress permission to do the things they do, why can't I find a clause in the Constitution that allows the government to control our schools. THINK, dammit! Maybe - just maybe - the entire Department of Education is UNCONSTITUTIONAL."-Michael Badnarik - Libertarian Presidential Candidate 2004

He will just fall on the floor from shock if "MOM" actually bought him some games. <big grin> But if it were anything else that he or my daughter were into I wouldn't hesitate to go get it. I do believe in providing resources within reason.

So, what role playing games do your members of your family enjoy? Give me some titles that I can go get.

Deana
